title: Harry S Truman National Historic Site: Park Home
body: Home to a People's President  President Harry S Truman took America from its traditional isolationism into the age of international involvement. Despite his power, he never forgot where he came from. Today, visitors can experience the surroundings Truman knew as a young man of modest ambition through his political career and final years as a former president.              The Truman Home   Take a guided tour of the Truman Home for an in-depth view of the personal and family life of the 33rd President of the United States          Online Exhibits   Harry S Truman NHS preserves  over 50,000 artifacts related to the Truman family.  Click below to see a selection of objects.            Social Media   Get connected with Facebook, twitter & more.  Experience the park in an entirely new way.        Truman Farm   Visit the family farm in Grandview where Harry lived for eleven years.  Grounds open daily. Audio tours available on site.              Oral History Project   Over the past 29 years, this program has continued to preserve important information passed down about the Truman familyâ€™s home life.        Second Floor Photographs   A photographic tour of the second floor of the Truman Home is available. Due to the fragile structure of the house the upstairs is not open.              Noland Home   See the home of Harry's cousins to learn more about the courtship of Harry & Bess and life in the Truman neighborhood. Open every day.        Wallace Homes   Home to Bess's brothers George and Frank Wallace, these homes behind the Truman Home show a close family bond. Homes not open to public.
